org.opentcs.util.communication

Class RMIRegistries

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opentcs.util.communication.RMIRegistries

  • public final class RMIRegistries
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides helper methods for working with RMI registries.

    • Method Detail

      • registryAvailable

        public static boolean registryAvailable(java.lang.String host,
                                        int port)
        Checks if a usable registry is available on the given host and port.
        Parameters:
        host - The host to check.
        port - The port to check.
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, a usable registry was found on the given host and port.

      • getWorkingRegistry

        @Deprecated
 @ScheduledApiChange(when="4.0.0")
public static java.rmi.registry.Registry getWorkingRegistry(java.lang.String host,
                                                                                                           int port)
        Deprecated. Scheduled for removal with release 4.0.0. Use lookupRegistry(String, int) instead.
        Returns a reference to a working registry on the given host and port, or null, if that's not possible.
        Parameters:
        host - The host to check.
        port - The port to check.
        Returns:
        A reference to a working registry on the given host and port, or null, if a working one was not found there.

      • lookupRegistry

        public static java.util.Optional<java.rmi.registry.Registry> lookupRegistry(java.lang.String host,
                                                                            int port)
        Returns a reference to a working registry on the given host and port, if there is one.
        Parameters:
        host - The host to check.
        port - The port to check.
        Returns:
        A reference to a working registry on the given host and port, if a working one was found there.

      • getOrCreateWorkingRegistry

        @Deprecated
 @ScheduledApiChange(when="4.0.0")
public static java.rmi.registry.Registry getOrCreateWorkingRegistry(int port)
        Deprecated. Scheduled for removal with release 4.0.0. Use lookupOrInstallRegistry(int) instead.
        Returns a reference to a working local registry, or null, if that's impossible. This method first checks if a local registry at the given port is available and usable. If so, a reference to it is returned, otherwise a new one is created. If that is not possible, either, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        port - The port at which the registry should be listening.
        Returns:
        A reference to a working local registry, or null, if getting or creating a working one was not possible.

      • lookupOrInstallRegistry

        public static java.util.Optional<java.rmi.registry.Registry> lookupOrInstallRegistry(int port)
        Returns a reference to a working local registry, if one already existed or a new one could be installed. This method first checks if a local registry at the given port is available and usable. If so, a reference to it is returned, otherwise a new one is created. If that is not possible, either, no reference is returned.
        Parameters:
        port - The port at which the registry should be listening.
        Returns:
        A reference to a working local registry, if getting or creating a working one was possible.

      • getOrCreateWorkingRegistry

        @Deprecated
 @ScheduledApiChange(when="4.0.0")
public static java.rmi.registry.Registry getOrCreateWorkingRegistry()
        Deprecated. Scheduled for removal with release 4.0.0. Use lookupOrInstallRegistry() instead.
        Returns a reference to a working local registry, or null, if that's impossible. This method first checks if a local registry at the default port is available and usable. If so, a reference to it is returned, otherwise a new one is created. If that is not possible, either, null is returned.
        Returns:
        A reference to a working local registry, or null, if getting or creating a working one was not possible.

      • lookupOrInstallRegistry

        public static java.util.Optional<java.rmi.registry.Registry> lookupOrInstallRegistry()
        Returns a reference to a working local registry, or null, if that's impossible. This method first checks if a local registry at the default port is available and usable. If so, a reference to it is returned, otherwise a new one is created. If that is not possible, either, null is returned.
        Returns:
        A reference to a working local registry, or null, if getting or creating a working one was not possible.
